p: Likewise, studies conducted in China characterizing different CDV isolates in mink breeding sites (non-canid wild species), raccoon dogs and foxes (wild canid species) showed the trend 530G and 549H [ 137]. In monkeys (non-canid species), there was a trend of 530G and 549Y with an additional substitution at another site of the protein H (542F) that may play an important role in CDV adaptation to primates ( Table 2) [ 137].
